item.title: SpaceX Falcon 9 and Japan's H-IIA launch!
item.description: In kNews for week 02/2018 I talk about Russia’s secret project CORONA, three Long March, a PSLV and the last Delta IV (M) launch ever.

item.title: What I Look Forward to in Space 2018
item.description: In kNews for Week 01/2018 I talk about the recent ZUMA launch of SpaceX and what I look forward to in 2018!

item.title: SpaceX Falcon 9 and Japan's H-IIA launch!
item.description: In kNews for week 51/2017 I speak about the launches of SpaceX Falcon 9 and Japan’s H-IIA going more into detail on how SpaceX’ going to recover their fairings.

item.title: Blue Origin’s New Shepard launched secretly!
item.description: Blue Origin’s New Shepard rocket shot their brand new “Crew Capsule 2.0” into a sub orbital trajectory above the Mojave desert. This happened on December 12th 2017 and was as far as I know not streamed live nor announced, so I call it secret! Blue Origin was founded by Jeff Bezos who is also the head at the e-commerce giant amazon. Next to New Shepard, Blue Origin is also working on its orbital class launch vehicle called New Glenn which will use 7 BE-4 engines burning liquid methane and oxygen on its first stage, unlike New Shepard which burns liquid Hydrogen. However, New Shepard’s BE-3 engine will probably be used on an expendable third stage of the rocket.

item.title: 3 Astronauts and 4 Rockets Launch!
item.description: In kNews for week 50/2017 I mainly talk about the upcoming Soyuz launch to the ISS carrying three astronauts, but I also mention three other launches namely: Rocket Lab’s Electron, SpaceX’ Falcon 9 and Arianespace’s Ariane 5!

item.title: SpaceX to Launch Tesla Roadster to Mars
item.description: Yep, it’s not a joke (as it seems). SpaceX’ Falcon Heavy will launch Elon Musk’s red Tesla Roaster to Mars on its maiden flight in January 2018 according to a tweet by Elon Musk. My illustration up top shows a Tesla Model X because this is the only one I got modeled in 3D which I used in my Tesla Project Loveday” entry. However, it is still unclear whether it will be one of the new 200 kWh Roadsters which will arrive at the market by 2020, or one if not the first Tesla Roadster Elon Musk ever owned himself. This would be quite emotional and a real loss for him should something go wrong! knocks on wood

item.title: Soyuz's Fregat Upper Stage Burned Up!
item.description: Sad news from Russia. The recently launched Soyuz - which I covered a little prematurely in kNews for week 46/2017, has had an anomaly on its Fregat (frigate) upper stage!

item.title: 6 + 2C + 3B*? = Chinese (中文) Launch Week
item.description: Two or three Chinese rockets are supposeds to launch in week 47/2017 and astronomers are talking about nothing but cigars.

item.title: Delta II, Falcon 9, Long March 4C and Soyuz launch!
item.description: In my (almost) weekly kNews episode for week 46/2017 I cover Delta II, Falcon 9, Launch March 4C and a Soyuz rocket launch! Yep, four rockets are planned to launch in a single week which is quite a lot!

item.title: kNews Space Has a New Home!
item.description: I decided to cancel my webspace subscription because I basically just link to my content found on my YouTube channel and do not host my own videos. It would be cool to have my videos hosted on my own server but webspace fast enough to deliver a good experience would be too expensive for me.
